storyInfo: The Plastic Knight hears from the Spokesman, the Flametail Knight suffers an accident, Maria and her uncle clash again. Knight life is hard.

attributes.content: What exactly is a knight competition?
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: Mr. Szewczyk, what do you think?
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: ...Forget the song and dance, Czarny, I’m busy.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Out with it. What are you up to?
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: I’m very sorry to say... the Roar Knightclub has decided to switch you out of pole position in their starting lineup for the Major. Their new safeguard knight ranks highly just as you do, and his Arts should be useful to the team.
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: This... is nothing like what we agreed...
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Of course, your down payment will still clear. But the rates for a knightclub’s reserve are an invariably different question. You understand this, correct?
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: Now, now... don’t make any hasty moves. Your child is celebrating a tenth birthday soon, I hear. You needn’t lose your job now over assaulting someone as insignificant as myself...
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: Roar Knightclub will still be paying you plenty. You needn’t make any efforts for at least the rest of the year.
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: I need the lineup corrected, for God’s sakes! I...
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: That’ll be up to your own performance, Szewczyk. There’s always a way to live on, is there not?
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: ...You’re not wrong.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: You could’ve just sent out any old envoy to tell me this. Why’d you need to meet me personally? Are all spokespeople this bored for something to do?
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Ah... don’t misunderstand me. I didn’t come out here specifically for you. I was only here to make sure of some event arrangements.
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: It seems we’ve been a little lax in parts. Our divisions have each encountered very minor bumps in the road, which some offenders are seeing fit to take advantage of.
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: ...Are you threatening me? Threatening 'Plastic' Knight Szewczyk to take on your dirty work?
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Nothing of the sort.
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: Then what are you trying to do here?
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Right now, I have two particular knights who are currently working to enter the arena... but, unfortunately, they clearly do not have the points to do so.
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: Pfah... If you want a knight to make it in, you have your ways...
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Don’t put it like that. There are times one must respect the rules, and keep some conduct undisclosed—
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: —Making use of the law versus violating it is a night and day affair, after all. The fundamental difference lies in whether the parties involved possess the capacity to do so.
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: Just give it one nod of assent, and we’ll add an event for the transfer of points, along with all its formalities. Of course, in much the same manner, I can settle of some of your complications with the Roar Knightclub...
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: How would you feel about that?
attributes.name: Spokesman Czarny

attributes.content: —OUT! The Strider Knight’s sole-mount accelerator devices are non-functional! That sudden brake knocks him off right before the finish—!
attributes.name: Greatmouth Mob

attributes.content: ACROSS THE LINE—! The winner, from Gloryfall Knightclub, is the Wisteria Knight! And right behind, Maria Nearl—hounding that medal!
attributes.name: Greatmouth Mob

attributes.content: With his accelerators out, the Strider Knight has fallen all the way from second place to seventh—! It’s not a good day to be the Strider!
attributes.name: Greatmouth Mob

attributes.content: It just goes to show how crucial a knight’s equipment is!
attributes.name: Greatmouth Mob

attributes.content: And Ellen Select Technologies, who provide intimate maintenance, repair and upgrades to your equipment with their comprehensive member plans, have provided a no-expense-spared package for our knights!
attributes.name: Greatmouth Mob

attributes.content: Phew... runner-up, huh?
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: (This way... I’m another step closer to the Major...)
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: (Auntie Zofia...)
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: Oh, there’s an unexpected customer.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Please, sit wherever you’d like.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Marcin... it’s really you? That tremendous knight of days gone by runs this little bar now?
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: They stripped old Marcin of his knighthood long ago. Now all he does is eat up his savings.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: How’d 'Plastic' Szewczyk find his way to this little place? Tell you the truth, this bar doesn’t see all that many active knights in it.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: If you’re tremendous past, Maria’s tremendous present. They carried a story about your bar on the entertainment news last night.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Hmph... tremendous all around. I’ll have a 'Red Edelweiss.'
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: This one’s on me.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: My pleasure.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Roar Guards’ training camp’s a long way away. I won’t let you waste the trip.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: So, you’ve come to enemy headquarters to spy on us, then? Right that old newspaper-worthy wrong for the Majors?
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: ...I’m not going to be in the Majors.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Huh... Roar Guards’ decision? Thought you and your sponsors were on pretty good personal terms?
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Ha. Personal terms. Managing a relationship with a corp is like dating a Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: As always, the decision came from the next floor up...
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Knights Association?
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Worse than that... try the General Chamber of Commerce.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Hum.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: I know what you want to say, Marcin. Up there, you’re thinking, 'how’s a tiny little Plastic Knight get into such a big mess?'
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: I still know my limits, and nobody goes this overkill on a knight who knows how to follow plans, so their problem is elsewhere.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: A rumor’s spreading door-to-door. People saying the Radiant Knight was never even Infected, that her exile from Kazimierz was more complicated than that...
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Like hell I know.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Put your guard down... I’m not probing you here, Marcin.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: I just want Czarny to learn there’s a price to pay for pissing about with nobles... and I’m assuming he’s got one eye on Maria Nearl too, doesn’t he?
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: ...The knights are joining hands and protesting the Association? This sort of thing won’t ever end well.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: I’m just trying not to be ridden roughshod.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Thanks for the drink... Marcin, one last word... when I was young, it was watching your matches that made me finally decide to become a knight.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Went the wrong way back then, looks like.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: No. I’m ready to go my own way now, aren’t I?
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: See you next time, old Marcin.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Szewczyk, my own last word... stay safe.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: ...Hmph. No knight ever needed to bow to the peddlers. Roar Knightclub’ll see things my way.
attributes.name: Plastic Knight

attributes.content: Hey, you’ve been tailing us for ages now. Time you showed your face, right?
attributes.name: 'Flametail' Sonna

attributes.content: Oh, the overbearing type... No, I do NOT like fans like you...
attributes.name: 'Flametail' Sonna

attributes.content: 'Wait—that bow—are you—?!'
attributes.name: 'Flametail' Sonna

attributes.content: —Thought I’d say that and keel over, Armorless Union assassin?
attributes.name: 'Flametail' Sonna

attributes.content: Hmm... so this is how you’re molded. Way you dodge about everywhere, no-one’s actually seen your looks before. Real gloomy line of work you’re in...
attributes.name: 'Flametail' Sonna

attributes.content: Don’t get the chance everyday—
attributes.name: 'Flametail' Sonna

attributes.content: ...Hey.
attributes.name: Ashlock Knight

attributes.content: —to have a real scrap, you and us.
attributes.name: 'Flametail' Sonna

attributes.content: Ah—auntie—
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: Oh... uncle...
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: I look away from you for a second, and you somehow dig yourself even deeper.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: And when are you planning to stop?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: The leadership has been asking me time and time again about you. Every day I work in the Publicity Department is spent sorting out the trouble you cause... Half of my hours at work are lost to waiting for direction from the leadership.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Go to the Knights Association this moment and exit the tournament. You don’t have the faintest idea what you’re doing.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Is that what you wanted to say...
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: You will not kill yourself over this, Maria.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You are a child of the Nearl family. You ought to know restraint.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: These annoyances all lie low in the face of the Major, so this is up to you to do, but you’ve already earned yourself plenty of attention.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Abandon the idea that you can force your way into the Major. Abandon, also, any idea that you’ve yet faced the strongest competition knights.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: But I don’t want to just sit and watch while the Nearl family’s nobility gets stripped—
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: —Vainglory.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: I’ve made it clear before that the Nearls do not need the approval of the Knights Association, obscene as it now is.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Have you somehow come to believe that without their recognition, our ancestors’ deeds would cease to exist? Nonsense! For all these years, the Nearl family stood alone to defend our name!
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: What one cannot do, one must abandon. When one does not know how to give up... that blind alley is their end.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Uncle...
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: Margaret has influenced you too much, Maria. She could never recognize her own ignorance, and you are not to blindly follow her example.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Don’t give me that look. Have I said anything wrong? And surmounting the rulesetters within their own rules? Lunatic ravings.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You know Margaret’s temper. What she ultimately despised was the commercialization of the competition knights. I thought she had some backbone...
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: And what happened? Back against the wall, she still chose the path of competition, to flaunt her 'convictions.' Yes, indeed. 'Convictions.'
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: And could she change anything?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Uncle... don’t talk about Margaret like this...
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: She could not.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: The one thing she changed was how the corporations treated the Nearl family! The one thing she accomplished was forcing my father, bedridden as he was, to clean up her mess!
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: 'The Radiant Knight' is a title she should’ve never been conferred! She has no power to shoulder any glory of the sort!
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Uncle!
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: So what about you...?
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: Aren’t you... working for the corporations, even now?
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: You forbid me from competing while you go play servant boy to the corporations and watch the Nearl family’s knighthood slip away? You can stomach that?!
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: You’re still young. For that, I won’t blame your ignorance... but you should show respect to your elders.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: This again...
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: The skyscrapers... that the people of Kazimierz built, generation upon generation, cast the shadows that hide you in your hometown, shielded by your elders. What could you see from this safety?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Did you truly believe you had something? As nothing more than a young, fledgling knight?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: When the sun dawned over the frontier fortresses, the Ursus skyscrapers drew their line in the  clouds on the horizon.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: The tower attendants recreated the motions of battle in the arena to please their nobles. The young steam knights donned the armor of old to temper and hone their skills.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Bounty hunters and robbers razed one destitute village after another, while the great cities were absorbed in hopes of building ever more arenas. One could call the harvest of a village versus the tax it pays comical.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: But all of that paled to the last sigh my father uttered on his deathbed. Not for Margaret, not for your parents—it was his lament given to all of Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: How could you not disappoint me?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You’re right, Maria, you’re right. I am good for nothing, nothing more than a corporate, captive burdenbeast.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: So. What about you?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: ...Director? No, just a quick personal matter to tend to... No, of course work takes priority over personal...
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: The project meeting? Today? No, I didn’t forget... Apologies, my greatest apologies, I’m very sorry, you’re right...
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I’ll be back there momentarily... What? No, he doesn’t understand the scope of the project... Yes, I’m sorry...
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Then if... If he could present in my stead... Yes, my apologies... The manager’s responsibility? I... Yes, this will be the last time. No, there won’t be a next time.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You may terminate me if this happens again. Yes, of course, I promise.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I am truly deeply sorry, Director.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: ...I do not have much time to waste, Maria. Give me an answer, now.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You won’t change my mind, Uncle.
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: You’re just like Margaret... you disgust me.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Your parents would find no pride in you. Take some time to calm down. Start thinking hard about who you really are.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: ...Please, just stop talking!
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: Ignorant of the world and its untold ways... Pray for blessings. That is all you have left.
attributes.name: Młynar
